knimeNode.name: Feature Selection Loop Start (1:1)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Start node for a feature selection loop

fullDescription.intro: This node is the start of the feature selection loop. The feature selection loop allows you to select, from all the features in the input data set, the subset of features that is best for model construction. With this node you determine (i) which features/columns are to be held fixed in the selection process. These constant or "static" features/columns are included in each loop iteration and are exempt from elimination; (ii) which selection strategy is to be used on the other (variable) features/columns and its settings; and (iii) the specific settings of the selected strategy.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Columns can be selected manually or by means of regular expressions. The columns in the left pane are the static columns, those in the right pane the variable columns. Since a feature selection process always has a target feature and a set of features to select from, there will always be at least one static column and more than one variable column. If you leave the left pane empty and run the node, you will get a warning. Columns can be moved from one pane to the other by clicking on the appropriate button in the middle.
Here you can choose between the selection strategies: Forward Feature Selection, Backward Feature Elimination, and Genetic Algorithm.

option.name: Use threshold for number of features

tab.option: Check this option if you want to set a bound for the number of selected features. Since Forward Feature Selection adds features while Backward Feature Elimination subtracts them, this will be an upper bound for Forward Feature Selection and a lower bound for Backward Feature Elimination.

option.name: Select threshold for number of features

tab.option: Set the upper or lower bound for the number of selected features.

option.name: Use lower bound for number of features

tab.option: Check this option if you want to set a lower bound for the number of selected features.

option.name: Use upper bound for number of features

tab.option: Check this option if you want to set an upper bound for the number of selected features.

Set the number of individuals in each population. Changing this value directly influences the maximal number of loop iterations which is Population size * (Number of generations + 1). This is just an upper bound, usually less iterations will be necessary.

Set the number of generations. Changing this value directly influences the maximal number of loop iterations which is Population size * (Number of generations + 1). This is just an upper bound, usually less iterations will be necessary.

Set the number of iterations. This is an upper bound. If the same feature subset is randomly generated for a second time, it won't be processed again but will be counted as iteration. Furthermore, if early stopping is enabled, the algorithm may stop before the max. number of iterations is reached.
Choose a seed to get reproducible results.

tab.name: Advanced Options
tab.option: Choose the strategy to use for the selection of offspring.
Set the fraction of survivors during evaluation of the next generation. 1 - fraction of survivors defines the fraction of offspring which is evaluated for the next generation.
Set the fraction of the best individuals within a generation that are transfered to the next generation without alternation.
Choose the strategy to use for crossover.
Set the crossover rate used to alter offspring.
Set the mutation rate used to alter offspring.
Check this option if you want to enable early stopping which means that the algorithm stops after a specified number of generations without improvement.
Set the number of generations/iterations without improvement used for early stopping.
